item.title: Wynona add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I will remember the kisses our lips raw with love and how you gave me everything you had and how I offered you what was left of me, and I will remember your small room the feel of you the light in the window your records your books our morning coffee our noons our nights our bodies spilled together sleeping the tiny flowing currents immediate and forever your leg my leg your arm my arm your smile and the warmth of you who made me laugh again." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!" -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Wynona add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "Here I should like to remark, for the sake of princes and princesses in general, that it is a low and contemptible thing to refuse to confess a fault, or even an error. If a true princess has done wrong, she is always uneasy until she has had an opportunity of throwing the wrongness away from her by saying: 'I did it; and I wish I had not; and I am sorry for having done it." -- George MacDonald

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Did it never strike your mind that what every woman says, some women may feel?" -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "The beauty or ugliness of a character lay not only in its achievements, but in its aims and impulses; its true history lay, not among things done, but among things willed." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "There were always in me, two women at least, one woman desperate and bewildered, who felt she was drowning and another who would leap into a scene, as upon a stage, conceal her true emotions because they were weaknesses, helplessness, despair, and present to the world only a smile, an eagerness, curiosity, enthusiasm, interest." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Wynona add a quote by anaïs nin
item.description: "I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing." -- anaïs nin

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Have patience with everything that remains unsolved in your heart. Try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books written in a foreign language. Do not now look for the answers. They cannot now be given to you because you could not live them. It is a question of experiencing everything. At present you need to live the question. Perhaps you will gradually, without even noticing it, find yourself experiencing the answer, some distant day." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "A work of art is good if it has arisen out of necessity. That is the only way one can judge it." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Wynona add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The highest form of love is to be the protector of another person’s solitude." -- Rainer Maria Rilke
